triples.name: Microbial consortium
triples.relevance: The paper studies microbial networks and their stability under salinity stress, building on existing microbial consortium research.

triples.name: Abiotic stress
triples.relevance: Salinity stress is a form of abiotic stress that affects microbial communities in aquatic environments.

triples.name: Microbiome
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes the aquatic microbiome's response to environmental changes and stress.

triples.name: Microbial ecology
triples.relevance: The paper investigates microbial diversity and structure changes in aquatic ecosystems under stress conditions.

triples.name: Taxonomy (biology)
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes taxonomic structure and succession of microbial communities.

triples.name: Ecological network
triples.relevance: The paper examines how microbial ecological networks change in complexity and stability under increasing salinity stress.

triples.name: Rare biosphere
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new insights into the distinct roles of rare biosphere members in stabilizing ecological networks under stress.

triples.name: Matthew effect
triples.relevance: The paper uses this principle to explain how abundant species have disproportionate influence, which weakens under stress conditions.

triples.name: Saltwater intrusion
triples.relevance: Seawater intrusion is one of the global environmental changes creating salinity stress on freshwater aquatic microbiomes.

triples.name: Ecosystem
triples.relevance: The paper examines how microbial networks maintain ecosystem functions and services under increasing environmental stress.
